title: Week 1: Introduction to Data Models
description: Overview of data models: relational, NoSQL, and graph databases. Learn the differences among data models and understand their respective use cases.

title: Week 2: Fundamentals of Distributed Databases
description: Basics of distributed systems and databases, including components of distributed databases and the CAP theorem.

title: Week 3: Query Processing Fundamentals
description: Introduction to query languages and processing, describing how basic queries function across various database models.

title: Week 4: Introduction to Hadoop and MapReduce
description: Overview of the Hadoop framework and the MapReduce processing paradigm, including implementation of a basic MapReduce application.

title: Week 5: Advanced Query Processing with Spark
description: Introduction to Apache Spark, focusing on performing data processing tasks using Spark SQL.

title: Week 6: NoSQL Systems Overview
description: Examine various NoSQL databases, comparing and contrasting systems like MongoDB and Cassandra.

title: Week 7: Integrating Data from Multiple Sources
description: Techniques for integrating and cleaning data, with a focus on ETL processes and tools.

title: Week 8: Data Management with Streaming Technologies
description: Stream processing and real-time data management techniques, analyzing data streams using Apache Kafka.

title: Week 9: Introduction to Cloud Computing
description: Fundamentals of cloud computing architectures and the different service models: IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.

title: Week 10: Managing Big Data in the Cloud
description: Utilizing cloud technologies for big data solutions, focusing on implementation of distributed databases in AWS.

title: Week 11: Data Pipelines and Workflow Management
description: Building and managing data pipelines using tools like Apache Airflow to enhance data workflow management.

title: Week 12: Advanced System Architectures
description: Evaluating architectural requirements for systems that support large language models (LLMs) and understanding their design.

title: Week 13: Team Project Development
description: Planning and executing a team project where students collaboratively design a data processing system.

title: Week 14: Project Presentations
description: Presenting and defending group project outcomes, with an emphasis on clear communication of results.

title: Week 15: Review and Reflection
description: Reflecting on learning outcomes and project experiences to evaluate personal growth throughout the course.

title: Week 16: Final Project Submission and Course Review
description: Submission of comprehensive project reports and conducting course evaluations.
